intro: Herrickia kingii var. barnebyana, commonly known as the Barneby's Herrickia, is a rare and striking plant native to specific regions of Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, hairy stems. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive blue-gray hue, and its flowers are typically yellow with purple markings. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade, making it a unique addition to specialized botanical collections. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for conservation and botanical study.
